name: BL1
site-address: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA322 formerly part of an industrial estate. Outline planning application for residential development of up to 150no. dwellings; access to be considered all other matters reserved
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL2
site-address: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA 321 formerly part of an industrial estate. Site in 2 parts, see above.
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL3
site-address: Land at Pankhurst Close Trading Estate, Pankhurst Close, Exmouth
notes: Site was formerly in employment use. Site has a planning application which at March 2016 had a resolution to grant permision and was awaiting a 106 agreement. Allocated in local plan SHLAA317.. Redevelopment to provide 50 residential units (including 20 affordable units)
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL5
site-address: Land and buildings at Winslade Park, Clyst St Mary
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for mixed use redevelopment , W344. Application not approved.. 14/2641 conversion of Winslade House to 61 residential units approved 18.05.2016. Hybrid outline application for 150 dwellings including full permission for 67 dwelling (conversion of Winslade House and stables, and 0.7ha of employment land use).
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL6
site-address: Land and buildings at 34 Cranford Avenue, Exmouth
notes: Works that constitute start on site 2016 but not complete. Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of 12 no apartments
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL7
site-address: Land North Of Acland Park, Feniton
notes: Application refused but allowed by appeal in 2014, S106 agreement progressed 2018. Redevelopment of site and construction of 32 dwellings
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL8
site-address: Land and Buildings at Former Cuttler Hammer Factory and Tumbling Weir Hotel Car Park, Ottery St Mary
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2. Townhouses under construction and building work started on conversioin of the old Switchgear factory.. Redevelopment of parcels of land making up the overall former Cuttler Hammer factory site and Tumbling Weir hotel car park. Comprising conversion of building to30 apartments, construction of 33 new dwellings and construction of 29 retirement apartments. West part of site substantially complete but factory site in progress and Tumbling Weir car park not started construction..
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL9
site-address: Land and buildings at Salston Manor Hotel, Ottery St Mary
notes: Change of use alteration and conversion of hotel and demolition and construction of side extension to provide 27 residential flats
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority
